Dear Senator Burdick:
As a librarian--a person concerned with educational
opportunity and with high standards of radio and
television broadcasting as a vital part of educational
opportunity—I an very much interested in the Educa¬
tional Television Facilities Act.
Such legislation should make educational television
available in regions which do not have it now and
improve the facilities of present educational
television stations.
With the inclusion of radio in this act, at compara¬
tively little expense, opportunities for good and
profitable listening will be further improved.
May I urge your favorable consideration of the
Educational Television Facilities Act.
Sincerely yours,
Mrs. Richard E. Frank
Librarian
